title: Patient Name
instruction: Only return the patient's name. Do not include the doctor's name or any other individuals. Ensure proper capitalization and spelling.

title: Chief Complaint
instruction: State the patient's chief complaint clearly and concisely. Avoid direct speech, additional context, or unrelated comments.

title: History of Present Illness
content: On 07-22-25 while playing basketball, he fell and experienced immediate pain, swelling, and limited motion in his right wrist.
He left the game immediately and sought care at Urgent Care the following day, where x-rays revealed an intra-articular distal radius fracture.
Despite initial denial of injury, he continued to seek care for evaluation and treatment.
Currently presenting with persistent right wrist pain, limited wrist motion, and limited pronation due to pain.
instruction: Provide a structured summary of the patient's illness. Include symptom onset, duration, severity, exacerbating/relieving factors, and past treatments. Avoid direct speech, filler words, or first-person phrasing. End each sentence with a period and ensure medical terminology and grammar are correct.

title: Past Medical History
instruction: Include prior diagnoses, surgeries, hospitalizations unrelated to the current issue. Do not include current complaints or the doctorâ€™s current plan. Maintain a professional tone and correct grammar.

title: Current Medications
instruction: List current medications with name (generic and brand), dose, route, frequency, and duration. Format clearly. If none, use the default.

title: Family History
instruction: Mention relevant family conditions. Specify relationship and age at diagnosis if known. If no family history is stated, return the default.

title: Social History
instruction: Include information on occupation, living situation, habits (smoking, alcohol, drug use), sexual history if relevant. Use professional language.

title: Allergies
instruction: Include medication, food, or environmental allergies mentioned. If none are noted, return the default.

title: HEENT
default: Eyes: No visual loss, blurred vision, double vision. Ears, Nose, Throat: No hearing loss, sneezing, congestion, runny nose or sore throat.
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no relevant information is found in the transcript. Do not fabricate details.

title: Skin
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no specific findings are mentioned. Avoid assumptions.

title: Cardiovascular
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no cardiovascular complaints or findings are present in transcript.

title: Respiratory
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no respiratory symptoms are mentioned.

title: Gastrointestinal
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no GI complaints are noted.

title: Genitourinary
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no GU symptoms are mentioned.

title: Neurological
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no neurological issues are described.

title: Constitutional
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no constitutional symptoms like fever, fatigue, or weight change are mentioned.

title: Musculoskeletal
content: Intra-articular distal radius fracture involving the radial styloid
Limited wrist motion secondary to pain
instruction: Describe any injuries or complaints. If absent, return 'Normal'.

title: Hematologic
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no hematologic symptoms are discussed.

title: Lymphatic
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no lymphatic issues are found.

title: Psychiatric
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no psychiatric concerns are mentioned.

title: Eye
instruction: Return 'Normal' unless specific eye-related physical exam findings are given.

title: General
instruction: If no specific general appearance or vitals are mentioned, return 'Normal'.

title: Skin
instruction: Avoid repetition. Use this only for physical exam findings related to skin. Return 'Normal' if not specified.

title: Head
instruction: Return 'Normal' unless physical findings of the head are present.

title: Ears
instruction: Return 'Normal' if not mentioned.

title: Nose
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no findings are documented.

title: Throat
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no throat-related exam is described.

title: Neck
instruction: Return 'Normal' unless neck findings are clearly documented.

title: Heart
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no abnormal heart findings are mentioned.

title: Lungs
instruction: Return 'Normal' if not discussed.

title: Abdomen
instruction: Return 'Normal' if not stated.

title: MUSCULOSKELETAL
content: Intra-articular distal radius fracture involving the radial styloid
Limited wrist motion secondary to pain
instruction: Avoid duplication. Ensure this section only includes relevant ROS info, not PE.

title: Neurological
instruction: Return 'Normal' unless PE findings specific to neurological system are noted.

title: Psychiatric
instruction: Return 'Normal' unless psychiatrist examination findings are documented.

title: Immunizations
instruction: Document any vaccinations mentioned, including date and type. Use the default if none are mentioned.

title: Lab Results
content: X-rays reviewed demonstrating an intra-articular distal radius fracture involving the radial styloid.
Three views of the right wrist show a stable fracture.
instruction: Include only completed lab tests. Do not list future or recommended labs. Mention type of test, date, and result. Do not repeat diagnosis here.

title: Assessment and Plan
content: Diagnosis: Intra-articular distal radius fracture involving the radial styloid.
Recommend protection with a short-arm cast.
Follow-up in 10 days for repeat x-rays.
instruction: Provide structured diagnosis, reasoning, and a treatment plan. Maintain clinical tone.

title: Follow Up
content: Review in 10 days for repeat x-rays and reassessment of fracture stability and healing progress.
Continue monitoring for signs of infection or complications during recovery.
instruction: Document follow-up timing, purpose, and review plan. Do not repeat the assessment or plan section.
